summary: Why it has to be Tony
title: Why it has to be Tony
body:
“I hope they remember you.”

So much is pointing to Tony Stark laying his life down in Avengers 4. Here’s why I think it’s true.

1. Marvel are marketing the film as the end of an era. It is. It’s the culmination of 20-something interconnected movies. Who better to close it out with an ~Ultimate Sacrifice~ than Tony Stark, their original flagship hero?

2. Tony Stark needs to complete his arc from genius-billionaire-playboy-philanthropist- to selfless hero. He has already shown that he’s willing to make the sacrifice play. He is the most flawed character in the MCU, and has made countless mistakes along the way. They’re well documented so I won’t mention them here. Tony Stark is a redemption arc and I think it would close out beautifully if Tony, “the egomaniac”, the “alcoholic”, the quippy futurist, sacrificed himself for the entire universe. No resurrections.

3. Captain America is the obvious choice. He’s a ready-made “hero” from the start. It would be too obvious for Cap to make the sacrifice play. I’d rather see the “man out of time” settle down and try his hand at a normal life. But who knows.

4. They have faked out Tony’s death twice. The first time in the Avengers. The next in Infinity War. Tony has had it in him to make the Big Sacrifice since the beginning. It makes sense that he’d be willing to go for it again. Again, no resurrections.

5. Tony dreaming about fatherhood is something that he won’t get to see. That scene feels ominous when I look back on it. They’ve built it so that we expect a “big wedding scene” at the end of Avengers 4. I don’t think we’ll see that. I tihnk they’re setting us up for a heroic tragedy.  I think Tony’s sacrifice leaves behind a legacy for the Avengers, Pepper, his kid, and his other kid, the spiderling himself, Peter Parker. 

“13 Greater love has no man than this: that a man lay down his life for his friends.”

6. I think Peter’s angst is what we’ll see play out in Spider-Man: Far From Home. Peter’s being taken under the wing of SHIELD, who see a Spider-Man without accountability, without a mentor, without a father figure. 

——————————

Think about Tony’s mistakes, as a futurist, a (low-key) alcoholic, an Avenger, and just as someone who’s trying to do the right thing. He’s someone who presents as a cocky blow-hard, but whose role as a “hero” is - gradually - making him a better person, the person he had in him all along.

That’s the Tony that we’ll see in Avengers 4. That’s the Tony that’ll give his life up. That’s the Tony that people remember.

blog.name: catatonyc
blog.title: as tony probably said at least once,
blog.description: cat·a·ton·ic /ˌkadəˈtänik/ (informal) of or in an immobile or unresponsive stupor. | dumb canon and non-canon tony stark quotes and content

summary:
tony: its not like were gay
bruce: yeah we dont put the pan in panic or anything like that
tony: two bros, chillin in a hot...
body:
tony: its not like were gay

bruce: yeah we dont put the pan in panic or anything like that

tony: two bros, chillin in a hot tub

–the next morning–

bruce: tony? why are you- why am i in your room?

tony: I- WH- WE WERE DOWNSTAIRS-

bruce: thats what i thought??

tony: …peter was staying overnight.

bruce: he couldnt. he wouldnt.

peter, laughing as friday livestreams the footage:

blog.description: just a blog where I try to figure out how to set an ao3feed

title: a life or death situation
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2SuZHgq

by tempestaurora

Harley was short-circuiting a little.

Luckily, Peter wasn’t.

Peter shoved up his jacket sleeve and clicked a button on the side of his watch. Harley had a matching one. Harley never wore his because he was irresponsible and liked to laugh in the face of good decision-making. Peter, who had sense, wore his every day, and the button sent a panic alarm directly to Iron Man.

Harley really needed to wear his watch more often.

Peter met his eyes. “It’s okay,” he whispered so quiet Harley could barely hear him. “We’re gonna be fine.”

Words: 2899, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 3 of wayward sons

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Harley Keener, Peter Parker, Tony Stark, Ned Leeds, Michelle Jones
  • Relationships: Harley Keener & Peter Parker, Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Harley Keener & Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Tony Stark Acting as Peter Parker’s Parental Figure, Tony Stark Acting as Harley Keener’s Parental Figure, D&D, Fluff, Also some pain, whatever

summary: What I've learned from my fictional heroes
body:
What I’ve learned from my fictional heroes

I guess I should start off by saying I’m not looking for reconigination on here or amything, i could care less about the amount the followers I get or how many notes for a repost. I’m just here to the content and amazing artist out there. And now I made this blog to vent,rant and just have a way to say things currently on my mind.

Too start this off, I’m honestly not sure where to begin when it comes to the characters in shows or books I look up too,who taught to me be the better person and gave memorable life lessons, but in honor of the man who brought heroes to life, Stan Lee, I’m going to do comics and what each character taught me. But before I do I’m letting you know now, I’m including DC not just marvel because I love both franchises and if you’re marvel who hates DC then leave and the same goes for DC fans who hate marvel, this is a neutral zone and I will not let you ruin it.

This what I’ve learned from comic book heroes:

Marvel:

Hawkeye/Clint barton: having any kind of disability is a chance to do something great, not to let yourself be told what you should do

Thor: Everyone can make mistakes,what matters is what you learn from it. Good or bad.

Tony stark/iron man: anyone can fight for what they believe in if they’re strong enough to get back up when pushed down.

Cap. America/Steve Rogers: Even when odds are against you, there’s always something to fight for.

Ant-man/ Hank pym: size doesn’t matter, actions do.

Black panther/T'challa: Lead by example, not by title

(Feel free to add more)

Dc:

Batman/Bruce wayne: killing is easy, mercy isn’t.

Green lantern/ hal jordan: Don’t let the fear of failure stop you

Wonder woman/ Diana prince: believe in the good of others and yourself

Flash/Barry Allen: take time to slow down and enjoy the now and here

Nightwing/Dick Grayson: even the most ordinary people can do great things

Barbra gordon/oracle/batgirl: Don’t give up on your ambitions, even when it seems like the only option.

Superman/Clark kent: sometimes it’s the small things that matter most

Red hood/ Jason Todd: Do what others won’t to protect the ones you care about

Spoiler/Stephanie brown: live to be the best you and nobody else

Blackbat/Cassandra cain: don’t let anyone tell you how to live your life

Red robin/Tim drake: There’s always something to look forward too

Robin/Damian wayne: the toughest people are the ones with the kindest hearts

Aquaman/Arthur curry: just because your different doesn’t mean you’re alone.

And that’s what I learned from these characters. if you want to add more go ahead, I’d like see what others learned from books,shows,etc.

summary:
Peter: hey Mr.Stark do you know why a meme is called a meme? 
Tony: I dont know peter, why? 
Peter: me. me. get it? me to me. we...
body:
Peter: hey Mr.Stark do you know why a meme is called a meme?

Tony: I dont know peter, why?

Peter: me. me. get it? me to me. we are all the same people.

Tony: ….. why are you like this?

reblog.comment:

Tony: I dont know peter, why?

Peter: me. me. get it? me to me. we are all the same people.

Tony: ….. why are you like this?

Peter: me. me. get it? me to me. we are all the same people.

Tony: ….. why are you like this?
